bwwExcerpt: Yes, but Shange's 90-minute collection of poems performed by seven women, each in a designated color (Shange undoubtedly means the pun) returns the adjective to its high-wattage definition. Director-choreographer Camille A. Brown's production stuns the daylights out of you.
showScoreExcerpt:
"Why delay the cheers? The revival of Ntozake Shange’s 1976 'for colored girls who have considered suicide/when the rainbow is not enuf' is stunning in every aspect. Stunning, you ask? Hasn’t the word long since frayed and deserved consigning to the critic’s trash bin? Yes, but Shange’s 90-minute collection of poems performed by seven women, each in a designated color (Shange undoubtedly means the pun) returns the adjective to its high-wattage definition."
